intro: Acrosorus streptophyllus, commonly known as the spiral fern, is a species of fern characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of fronds. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is native to tropical regions of South America. The plant features compound fronds with a distinctive zigzag or spiral pattern along their length. Its leaves are typically leathery and dark green, with a rough texture. Acrosorus streptophyllus is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
